p: The phytochemical profile of MPLI and MPFI EOs is in line with most of the previous studies, which showed pulegone as the main constituent of the M. pulegium EO (50.0%â€“73.3%) [ 26, 27]. Moreover, pulegone/isomenthone ratios (60.3%/22.7% and 66.8%/34.8%) were comparable with the ones observed in MPLI (56.8%/34.0%) and MPFI (60.2%/30.9%), were found by Rodrigues and co-workers [ 18] and Fancello and co-workers [ 28], respectively.
